Tourny Log 1/2/3

POV: Kilians

Log Rating: 3.0000

here u go

Start logging: 14.05.2005 19:54
GT tick in 10
Zug flies north.
Epso flies north.
You follow Zug north.
Lashe flies in from the south.
Vittu flies in from the south.
Sharmaine flies in from the south.
Southern Road
A massive, charred crater is all that remains of the southeastern part
of the city. Whatever struck this city and left it in its ruined state must
have rivaled the destructive force of the Cataclysm to have levelled this
large a section of the city. Despite it's poor condition, the road leading
west is in much better condition than the road that once lead eastward.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

701H 56V 13822X 1712C Exits:NSW> You tell your group 'tick in 10'

701H 56V 13822X 1712C Exits:NSW>
Zug flies north.
Epso flies north.
You follow Zug north.
Lashe flies in from the south.
Vittu flies in from the south.
Sharmaine flies in from the south.
Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the city.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

701H 55V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW>
Epso utters some strange words.
Epso's skin begins to shine like steel.

701H 55V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW>
Zug flies north.
Epso flies north.
You follow Zug north.
Lashe flies in from the south.
Vittu flies in from the south.
Sharmaine flies in from the south.
Northern Road
The city square lies just to the south, where the sounds of children
laughing and other familiar city sounds filled the air. Now there is an
eery silence, save for the noises that you make. This road runs
north-south, joining the cities fountain with the it's northern gate, while
a narrow street leads east, towards the remains of an important looking
building.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

701H 54V 13822X 1712C Exits:NES>
Zug flies east.
Epso flies east.
You follow Zug east.
Lashe flies in from the west.
Vittu flies in from the west.
Sharmaine flies in from the west.
Before the Courthouse
The building to the south once served as the city hall and courthouse
for Tarsis. Even now, in its dilapidated state, the building still has an
air of importance and authority. One of the main city roads lies to the
west, while the road leads eastward, towards the cities former markets.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

701H 53V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW>
Zug flies east.
Epso flies east.
You follow Zug east.
Lashe flies in from the west.
Vittu flies in from the west.
Sharmaine flies in from the west.
The Ruined Market
Broken stone tiles crunch under your feet; the massive stone tiles that
once endured the footfalls of men and horses alike lie shattered and broken
here. The surrounding buildings are in the same condition: several have
missing walls and roofs while others have entirely collapsed onto
themselves.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

701H 52V 13822X 1712C Exits:NSW>
Zug flies south.
Epso flies south.
You follow Zug south.
Lashe flies in from the north.
Vittu flies in from the north.
Sharmaine flies in from the north.
A Shattered Road
The state of the road has long since fallen from its former grace. This
once busy, bustling market road has seen few travelers in recent times.
Skeletons of the buildings that once bordered the road are all that is
left, save the restaurant to the east that has somehow, miraculously
survived all this time.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

701H 51V 13822X 1712C Exits:NES>
Zug flies east.
Epso flies east.
You follow Zug east.
Lashe flies in from the west.
Vittu flies in from the west.
Sharmaine flies in from the west.
Pierre's Fine Tarsis Ham
Somehow, this restaurant has survived the devastation, destruction and
decay of time and remains as immaculate as the day it was last seen on
Krynn. The fragrant scent of ham still lingers in the air, making your
mouth water and your stomach growl. Some divine power has protected this
place, and for reasons unknown to you, this place feels very important.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

Epso utters some strange words.

701H 50V 13822X 1712C Exits:W> gigYou giggle.

701H 50V 13822X 1712C Exits:W> scYou are Kilians Stormblade, Dark Tide of the Blood Sea Pirates, a level 30 Warrior.
You are rank 12.
You are 34 years old.
You have 701(701) hit and 74(87) movement points.
Your behaviour has been Good.
The warmth of good envelopes your soul.
You have scored 144986178 exp, and have 1712(8101) steel coins.
You need 13822 more experience to advance.
You have died 15 horrible deaths.
You have been connected for 49 minute(s).
You have been playing for 13 day(s), 19 hour(s) and 10 minute(s).
Your equipment is currently not being concealed.
You are standing.
You are flying.
You are following Zug.
You are affected by the following:
sanctuary
fly
protection from evil
heroism
sacred ward
detect invisibility

A Shattered Road
The state of the road has long since fallen from its former grace. This
once busy, bustling market road has seen few travelers in recent times.
Skeletons of the buildings that once bordered the road are all that is
left, save the restaurant to the east that has somehow, miraculously
survived all this time.

701H 73V 13822X 1712C Exits:NES>
Zug flies south.
Epso flies south.
You follow Zug south.
Lashe flies in from the north.
Vittu flies in from the north.
Sharmaine flies in from the north.
Eastern Road
Weeds separated and broken through the stone tiles that once made up
this road, but even those weeds have long since died away. Each footfall
echoes through the shattered, skeletal remains of the buildings to the
north. All that remains of the southeastern corner of the city is a huge,
ominous crater.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

701H 72V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW>
Zug flies east.
Epso flies east.
You follow Zug east.
Lashe flies in from the west.
Vittu flies in from the west.
Sharmaine flies in from the west.
East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

701H 71V 13822X 1712C Exits:NW>
Zug flies north.
Epso flies north.
You follow Zug north.
Lashe flies in from the south.
Vittu flies in from the south.
Sharmaine flies in from the south.
Wall Road
All that is left of the road to the north is a huge pile of rubble. The
outer city wall has fallen inward, blocking the path to the north. A small
road leads west, into the marketplace, and the cities east gate is just a
short distance south from here.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.
Furcifer, Scoundrel of Silvanost is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

701H 70V 13822X 1712C Exits:SW>
Furcifer flies south.

701H 70V 13822X 1712C Exits:SW>
Furcifer flies in from the south.

701H 70V 13822X 1712C Exits:SW>
Furcifer flies west.

701H 70V 13822X 1712C Exits:SW>
Zug flies west.
Epso flies west.
You follow Zug west.
Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
Sharmaine flies in from the east.
The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with rubble.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

701H 69V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW>
Zug flies west.
Epso flies west.
You follow Zug west.
Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
Sharmaine flies in from the east.
Before the Bank
The broken road leading to the cities bank crunches and cracks beneath
your feet. Having survived the chaos and destruction that took this city to
ruin, then withstanding the gradual decay of time has left this road in a
dismal state of ruin. Small chips of stone and gravel crunch beneath your
feet and the floor is cracked and broken in several places, leaving the
floor very uneven and difficult to traverse.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

Epso flies east.
You follow Zug east.
Lashe flies in from the west.
Vittu flies in from the west.
Sharmaine flies in from the west.
The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an

was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense

701H 67V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW>
Zug flies north.
Epso flies north.
You follow Zug north.
Lashe flies in from the south.
Vittu flies in from the south.
Sharmaine flies in from the south.
Wall Road
Once there was an immense lookout tower at the northeast corner of
Tarsis that provided city guards with a vantage point to survey the
surrounding landscape. That tower collapsed inward, into the city, bringing
a large section of the city wall with it. The entire road leading east is
blocked by the fallen stone and rubble now, the only exits are a road
leading south into the market, and west towards the northern gate.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

701H 66V 13822X 1712C Exits:SW>
Zug flies west.
Epso flies west.
You follow Zug west.
Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
Sharmaine flies in from the east.
North Gate
The northern gate of Tarsis once stood as an inpenetrable boundary to
would-be attackers from the Plains of Dust. Guards would patrol this area
and often and protected the cities inhabitants from the nomads and common
criminals that dwelled within the Plains. Now the shattered gate stands as
an eternal testament to their failure: the gate itself has long been torn
out of its frame and shattered onto the stone road of the city.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

701H 65V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW> bas furciferYou couldn't find what you were looking for.
Zug flies west.
Epso flies west.
You follow Zug west.
Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
Sharmaine flies in from the east.
A Fallen Guardpost
Remnants of the guard tower still sit atop the walls of the city here,
although not nearly enough to remain usable. Splinters of wood are all that
remains of the supporting beams and the ladder that were once used to gain
access to the tower.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.

. . . is outlined with a dim aura.

701H 64V 13822X 1712C Exits:EW>
Zug flies west.
Epso flies west.
You follow Zug west.
Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
Sharmaine flies in from the east.
The Northern Park Entrance
Twisted, crushed iron, painted in rust, is all that remains of the
fence and gate that used to separate the park from the city. The grass that
once bordered the path into the park has been replaced by dust while the
path itself has been broken by weeds.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.

. . . has a metallic luster.

701H 63V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW>
Zug flies west.
Epso flies west.
You follow Zug west.
Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
Sharmaine flies in from the east.
Before the Library
Two large wooden double doors in the southern wall once opened to
scholars seeking the knowledge and wisdom that was housed within the Great
Tarsis Library. Now only a single, beaten door remains, barely hanging from
its rusted hinges, threatening to fall and shatter itself on the stone
floor. The wall to the north is a crumbling testament to the power of time
and neglect: what was once relied upon to protect the city from invaders is
little more than a mound of stones that a small child could surmount.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

701H 62V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW>
Zug flies west.
Epso flies west.
You follow Zug west.
Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
Sharmaine flies in from the east.
The Back Alley
Even though the walls of the city are crumbling and large portions of
it are missing, this back-alley is still cast in shadows. Various thugs
once frequented this place, preying on hapless library-goers that had lost
their way. The library itself rests to the south, a shattered, pathetic
shell of its former glory.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.

. . . has a metallic luster.

. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

Before the Library

701H 60V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW>
Zug flies south.
Epso flies south.
You follow Zug south.
Lashe flies in from the north.
Vittu flies in from the north.
Sharmaine flies in from the north.
Lost Knowledge
Once, great scholars came to this library to scour over tomes
containing knowledge of the arcane arts, history, science, mathematics and
countless other subjects. Now all of that is lost. Whatever was not
crushed, burned or otherwise destroyed has long since turned to dust. The
countless shelves that were once lined with books are nowhere to be seen
amidst the rubble.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

701H 59V 13822X 1712C Exits:N>
Zug flies north.
Epso flies north.
You follow Zug north.
Lashe flies in from the south.
Vittu flies in from the south.
Sharmaine flies in from the south.
Sharmaine kneels down and studies the ground.
Before the Library
Two large wooden double doors in the southern wall once opened to
scholars seeking the knowledge and wisdom that was housed within the Great
Tarsis Library. Now only a single, beaten door remains, barely hanging from
its rusted hinges, threatening to fall and shatter itself on the stone
floor. The wall to the north is a crumbling testament to the power of time
and neglect: what was once relied upon to protect the city from invaders is
little more than a mound of stones that a small child could surmount.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

701H 58V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW>
Zug flies west.
Epso flies west.
You follow Zug west.
Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
Sharmaine flies in from the east.
Sharmaine kneels down and studies the ground.
The Back Alley
Even though the walls of the city are crumbling and large portions of
it are missing, this back-alley is still cast in shadows. Various thugs
once frequented this place, preying on hapless library-goers that had lost
their way. The library itself rests to the south, a shattered, pathetic
shell of its former glory.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

Sharmaine kneels down and studies the ground.
The Northern Park Entrance
Twisted, crushed iron, painted in rust, is all that remains of the
fence and gate that used to separate the park from the city. The grass that
once bordered the path into the park has been replaced by dust while the
path itself has been broken by weeds.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

A Fallen Guardpost
Remnants of the guard tower still sit atop the walls of the city here,
although not nearly enough to remain usable. Splinters of wood are all that
remains of the supporting beams and the ladder that were once used to gain
access to the tower.

Lost Knowledge
Once, great scholars came to this library to scour over tomes
containing knowledge of the arcane arts, history, science, mathematics and
countless other subjects. Now all of that is lost. Whatever was not
crushed, burned or otherwise destroyed has long since turned to dust. The
countless shelves that were once lined with books are nowhere to be seen
amidst the rubble.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)

. . . has a metallic luster.

. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

Lashe flies in from the west.
Vittu flies in from the west.
Sharmaine flies in from the west.
North Gate
The northern gate of Tarsis once stood as an inpenetrable boundary to
would-be attackers from the Plains of Dust. Guards would patrol this area
and often and protected the cities inhabitants from the nomads and common
criminals that dwelled within the Plains. Now the shattered gate stands as
an eternal testament to their failure: the gate itself has long been torn
out of its frame and shattered onto the stone road of the city.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

685H 45V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW> sca
Zug flies east.
Epso flies east.
You follow Zug east.
Lashe flies in from the west.
Vittu flies in from the west.
Sharmaine flies in from the west.
Wall Road
Once there was an immense lookout tower at the northeast corner of
Tarsis that provided city guards with a vantage point to survey the
surrounding landscape. That tower collapsed inward, into the city, bringing
a large section of the city wall with it. The entire road leading east is
blocked by the fallen stone and rubble now, the only exits are a road
leading south into the market, and west towards the northern gate.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

Sharmaine flies in from the north.
The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are hollowed
scashells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with rubble.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)

. . . has a metallic luster.

. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

Wall Road
All that is left of the road to the north is a huge pile of rubble. The
outer city wall has fallen inward, blocking the path to the north. A small
road leads west, into the marketplace, and the cities east gate is just a
short distance south from here.

Sharmaine flies in from the north.
East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)

Sharmaine flies in from the east.
Eastern Road
Weeds separated and broken through the stone tiles that once made up
this road, but even those weeds have long since died away. Each footfall
echoes through the shattered, skeletal remains of the buildings to the
north. All that remains of the southeastern corner of the city is a huge,
ominous crater.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

685H 40V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW>

You follow Zug west.
Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
Sharmaine flies in from the east.
Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the city.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

Western Road
Large cracks in the stone tiles of the road indicate that the
foundation this road was set on has shifted and changed over time. This
road leads east to the cities fountain, and westwards towards the Tarsis
wastelands.

Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
Sharmaine flies in from the east.
Western Road
This road runs east-west, from the Tarsis fountain towards the
wastelands. A small road leads north from here, past the old Tarsis temple
and towards the park. Immediately to the south is a row of broken
buildings, most of them empty shells or heaps of rubble.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
Sharmaine flies in from the east.
Near the Tarsis Wastelands
The broken road continues westward, towards the Tarsis Wastelands which
was once known for the vagrants and criminals that occupied the area. Now
it, like the rest of the city, is barren and desolate. A road branches off
to the south, leading towards the cities inn, while the main road leads
eastward, towards the city square.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

Eastern Road
Weeds separated and broken through the stone tiles that once made up
this road, but even those weeds have long since died away. Each footfall
echoes through the shattered, skeletal remains of the buildings to the
north. All that remains of the southeastern corner of the city is a huge,
ominous crater.

701H 56V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW>
Zug flies east.
Epso flies east.
You follow Zug east.
Lashe flies in from the west.
Vittu flies in from the west.
Sharmaine flies in from the west.
East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)

. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

road leads west, into the marketplace, and the cities east gate is just a
short distance south from here.

Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
Sharmaine flies in from the east.
The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are hollowed
scashells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with rubble.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)

Lashe flies in from the south.
Vittu flies in from the south.
Sharmaine flies in from the south.
Wall Road
Once there was an immense lookout tower at the northeast corner of
Tarsis that provided city guards with a vantage point to survey the
surrounding landscape. That tower collapsed inward, into the city, bringing
a large section of the city wall with it. The entire road leading east is
blocked by the fallen stone and rubble now, the only exits are a road
leading south into the market, and west towards the northern gate.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)

A Broken Road
Broken stone tile and long dead weeds litter this street. The buildings
bordering the street have all fallen to ruin: entire walls are missing,
roofs have collapsed. This city has fallen far from its former grace.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)

Southern Road
A massive, charred crater is all that remains of the southeastern part
of the city. Whatever struck this city and left it in its ruined state must
have rivaled the destructive force of the Cataclysm to have levelled this
large a section of the city. Despite it's poor condition, the road leading
west is in much better condition than the road that once lead eastward.

A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

You follow Zug south.
Lashe flies in from the north.
Vittu flies in from the north.
Sharmaine flies in from the north.
A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates. These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

Sharmaine flies in from the east.
The Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

The Tarsis Wastelands
Once, these Wastelands served as a walking ground for muggers,
prostitutes, thieves and the like, but now it is dead and barren. The
remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the south,
but it had collapsed onto itself a long time ago, destroying whatever might
have been in it.

A Path Through the Park

park has been replaced with a giant crater.

the entire western half of the park. The soil is still charred and burned

this ledge is back east, towards the remainder of the park.

701H 17V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> lA Path Through the Park
Whats left of the Tarsis park extends east and west from here, although
only a short distance to the west. The trees here have long-since died
away, only a few withering stumps remain as a reminder of the plant life
that once flourished here.

Forgotten Park
The Tarsis park has fallen to ruin through years of neglect and decay.
Dry, withered stumps are all that remains of the majestic trees that once
grew here. There is a very wide crack to the east, making it impossible to
move further in that direction.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)

Forgotten Park
The soil here is dry and in such poor shape that not even weeds could
grow here. The trees that once filled this park are nearly all gone, in
fact there is no indication that this was ever a park. This area feels
strangely dead and desolate.

The steel bars that make up the fence that separate the park from the
rest of the city are horribly twisted and mangled here at the southeastern
corner of the park. A single, small building can be seen a short distance
to the northwest, but aside from that, there is very little to look at
here.

Forgotten Park
The buildings that once bordered the eastern section of the park have
collapsed into themselves and the plants that once thrived here have
long-since died away, leaving a very bleak view from here. The Rangers
Guild was once housed in a small building to the west, but that building
now looks as though it has been abandoned for quite some time.

Forgotten Park
A large crack in the ground to the west separates this area from the
western portion of the park. The crack seems to extend very far into the
earth and is far too wide to leap across. The ground itself is dry and
cracked, you doubt anything could ever grow here again.

The Rangers Guild
This small building once had several windows facing all directions and
was open to the environment: it was a very relaxing and pleasing place to
study nature; however, now the glass windows have all been shattered and
there is nothing to view through them but dust and decay.

Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
Sharmaine flies in from the east.
A Path Through the Park
This dry, dusty pathy leads north-south through the old Tarsis park.
This park was once full of life, a lush, vibrant forest rich with color and
sound, but now it is a desolate, lonely place. The entire west half of the
park has been replaced with a giant crater.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.

Before the Temple
Dry dust and sand have settled on the floor of the road here, stirring
up into small clouds with every footstep. The once-lush Tarsis Park lies in
ruin to the north, and the entrance to the cities temple is to the west.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

Western Road
This road runs east-west, from the Tarsis fountain towards the
wastelands. A small road leads north from here, past the old Tarsis temple
and towards the park. Immediately to the south is a row of broken
buildings, most of them empty shells or heaps of rubble.

Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the city.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

Eastern Road
Weeds separated and broken through the stone tiles that once made up
this road, but even those weeds have long since died away. Each footfall
echoes through the shattered, skeletal remains of the buildings to the
north. All that remains of the southeastern corner of the city is a huge,
ominous crater.

Sharmaine flies in from the west.
East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)

474H 54V 13822X 1712C [Kilians:Fair] [Lashe:V.Good] Exits:NW> lEast Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.
Grant the Male Hylar Dwarf is standing here. (flying)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here, fighting YOU. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.

Eastern Road
Weeds separated and broken through the stone tiles that once made up
this road, but even those weeds have long since died away. Each footfall
echoes through the shattered, skeletal remains of the buildings to the
north. All that remains of the southeastern corner of the city is a huge,
ominous crater.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.

. . . has a metallic luster.

Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the city.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

Western Road
Large cracks in the stone tiles of the road indicate that the
foundation this road was set on has shifted and changed over time. This
road leads east to the cities fountain, and westwards towards the Tarsis
wastelands.

Western Road
This road runs east-west, from the Tarsis fountain towards the
wastelands. A small road leads north from here, past the old Tarsis temple
and towards the park. Immediately to the south is a row of broken
buildings, most of them empty shells or heaps of rubble.

The Tarsis Wastelands
Once, these Wastelands served as a walking ground for muggers,
prostitutes, thieves and the like, but now it is dead and barren. The
remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the south,
but it had collapsed onto itself a long time ago, destroying whatever might
have been in it.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

The Tarsis Wastelands
Clouds of dry dust and sand fill the air, stirred up from every
footstep, making it difficult to breath. There is almost nothing to see in
this area, save the fallen city of Tarsis to the east.

The Tarsis Wastelands
Once, these Wastelands served as a walking ground for muggers,
prostitutes, thieves and the like, but now it is dead and barren. The
remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the south,
but it had collapsed onto itself a long time ago, destroying whatever might
have been in it.

Western Road
This road runs east-west, from the Tarsis fountain towards the
wastelands. A small road leads north from here, past the old Tarsis temple
and towards the park. Immediately to the south is a row of broken
buildings, most of them empty shells or heaps of rubble.

Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the city.

Eastern Road
Weeds separated and broken through the stone tiles that once made up
this road, but even those weeds have long since died away. Each footfall
echoes through the shattered, skeletal remains of the buildings to the
north. All that remains of the southeastern corner of the city is a huge,
ominous crater.

East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.

Wall Road
All that is left of the road to the north is a huge pile of rubble. The
outer city wall has fallen inward, blocking the path to the north. A small
road leads west, into the marketplace, and the cities east gate is just a
short distance south from here.

The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with rubble.

Before the Bank
The broken road leading to the cities bank crunches and cracks beneath
your feet. Having survived the chaos and destruction that took this city to
ruin, then withstanding the gradual decay of time has left this road in a
dismal state of ruin. Small chips of stone and gravel crunch beneath your
track grantfeet and the floor is cracked and broken in several places, leaving the
floor very uneven and difficult to traverse.

The Bank
Shattered wooden stalls are all that remains of this bank. The
furniture that once filled this bank is broken and shattered, and the vault
that once occupied the rear of the bank has been crushed by portions of the
building that have collapsed onto it.

Northern Road
The stone tiles of this road have long since lost their form and
structure: the road here is uneven and cracked, even missing in some parts.
Broken stone and gravel speckle the road, causing each footfall to create
an eery "crunching" sound. The main road runs north, towards the city
gates, and south, towards the fountain and city square. A smaller road
leads eastward towards the market.

North Gate
The northern gate of Tarsis once stood as an inpenetrable boundary to
would-be attackers from the Plains of Dust. Guards would patrol this area
and often and protected the cities inhabitants from the nomads and common
criminals that dwelled within the Plains. Now the shattered gate stands as
bas prominaan eternal testament to their failure: the gate itself has long been torn
out of its frame and shattered onto the stone road of the city.

Northern Road
The city square lies just to the south, where the sounds of children
laughing and other familiar city sounds filled the air. Now there is an
eery silence, save for the noises that you make. This road runs
north-south, joining the cities fountain with the it's northern gate, while
a narrow street leads east, towards the remains of an important looking
building.

wastelands. A small road leads north from here, past the old Tarsis temple
and towards the park. Immediately to the south is a row of broken
buildings, most of them empty shells or heaps of rubble.

Near the Tarsis Wastelands
The broken road continues westward, towards the Tarsis Wastelands which
was once known for the vagrants and criminals that occupied the area. Now
it, like the rest of the city, is barren and desolate. A road branches off
to the south, leading towards the cities inn, while the main road leads
eastward, towards the city square.

The Tarsis Wastelands
Once, these Wastelands served as a walking ground for muggers,
prostitutes, thieves and the like, but now it is dead and barren. The
remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the south,
but it had collapsed onto itself a long time ago, destroying whatever might
have been in it.

Western Road
Large cracks in the stone tiles of the road indicate that the
foundation this road was set on has shifted and changed over time. This
road leads east to the cities fountain, and westwards towards the Tarsis

Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the city.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

Eastern Road
Weeds separated and broken through the stone tiles that once made up
this road, but even those weeds have long since died away. Each footfall
echoes through the shattered, skeletal remains of the buildings to the
north. All that remains of the southeastern corner of the city is a huge,
ominous crater.

East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

Wall Road
All that is left of the road to the north is a huge pile of rubble. The
outer city wall has fallen inward, blocking the path to the north. A small
road leads west, into the marketplace, and the cities east gate is just a
short distance south from here.

The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with rubble.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

Wall Road
Once there was an immense lookout tower at the northeast corner of
Tarsis that provided city guards with a vantage point to survey the
surrounding landscape. That tower collapsed inward, into the city, bringing
a large section of the city wall with it. The entire road leading east is
blocked by the fallen stone and rubble now, the only exits are a road
leading south into the market, and west towards the northern gate.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.

Lashe flies in from the east.
Sharmaine flies in from the east.
North Gate
The northern gate of Tarsis once stood as an inpenetrable boundary to
would-be attackers from the Plains of Dust. Guards would patrol this area
and often and protected the cities inhabitants from the nomads and common
criminals that dwelled within the Plains. Now the shattered gate stands as
an eternal testament to their failure: the gate itself has long been torn
out of its frame and shattered onto the stone road of the city.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.

. . . has a metallic luster.

A Fallen Guardpost
Remnants of the guard tower still sit atop the walls of the city here,
although not nearly enough to remain usable. Splinters of wood are all that
remains of the supporting beams and the ladder that were once used to gain
access to the tower.

The Northern Park Entrance
Twisted, crushed iron, painted in rust, is all that remains of the
fence and gate that used to separate the park from the city. The grass that
once bordered the path into the park has been replaced by dust while the
path itself has been broken by weeds.

Sharmaine flies in from the east.
Before the Library
Two large wooden double doors in the southern wall once opened to
scholars seeking the knowledge and wisdom that was housed within the Great
Tarsis Library. Now only a single, beaten door remains, barely hanging from
its rusted hinges, threatening to fall and shatter itself on the stone
floor. The wall to the north is a crumbling testament to the power of time
and neglect: what was once relied upon to protect the city from invaders is
little more than a mound of stones that a small child could surmount.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)

The Back Alley
Even though the walls of the city are crumbling and large portions of
it are missing, this back-alley is still cast in shadows. Various thugs
once frequented this place, preying on hapless library-goers that had lost
their way. The library itself rests to the south, a shattered, pathetic
shell of its former glory.

Looking down:

587H 25V 13822X 1712C Exits:SW> You tell your group 'tick in 10'

587H 25V 13822X 1712C Exits:SW> lWall Road
Once there was an immense lookout tower at the northeast corner of
Tarsis that provided city guards with a vantage point to survey the
surrounding landscape. That tower collapsed inward, into the city, bringing
a large section of the city wall with it. The entire road leading east is
blocked by the fallen stone and rubble now, the only exits are a road
leading south into the market, and west towards the northern gate.
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

587H 25V 13822X 1712C Exits:SW>
Zug flies south.
Epso flies south.
You follow Zug south.
Lashe flies in from the north.
The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with rubble.
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

All that is left of the road to the north is a huge pile of rubble. The
outer city wall has fallen inward, blocking the path to the north. A small
road leads west, into the marketplace, and the cities east gate is just a
short distance south from here.

587H 23V 13822X 1712C Exits:SW>
Zug flies south.
Epso flies south.
You follow Zug south.
Lashe flies in from the north.
Vittu flies in from the north.
East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

Wall Road
Once there was an immense lookout tower at the northeast corner of
Tarsis that provided city guards with a vantage point to survey the
surrounding landscape. That tower collapsed inward, into the city, bringing
a large section of the city wall with it. The entire road leading east is

587H 19V 13822X 1712C Exits:SW>
Zug flies west.
Epso flies west.
You follow Zug west.
Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
North Gate
The northern gate of Tarsis once stood as an inpenetrable boundary to
would-be attackers from the Plains of Dust. Guards would patrol this area
and often and protected the cities inhabitants from the nomads and common
criminals that dwelled within the Plains. Now the shattered gate stands as
an eternal testament to their failure: the gate itself has long been torn
out of its frame and shattered onto the stone road of the city.
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

587H 18V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW> Your stomach refuses to eat a frosted tin ring!
Your stomach refuses to eat the ring of the forge!
Your stomach refuses to eat an ancient medallion!
Your stomach refuses to eat a thin sheet of hardened granite!
Your stomach refuses to eat an adamantite helmet!
Your stomach refuses to eat a pair of unfinished mithril legplates!
Your stomach refuses to eat a pair of black climbing talons!
Your stomach refuses to eat a pair of spiked sterling gauntlets!
Your stomach refuses to eat some red dragon scale sleeves!
Your stomach refuses to eat a wooden shield of dragons!
Your stomach refuses to eat a minotaur's weapons harness!
Your stomach refuses to eat a spiked leather warbelt!
Your stomach refuses to eat a band of power!
Your stomach refuses to eat a diamond studded dog collar!
Your stomach refuses to eat a dwarven morningstar!
Your stomach refuses to eat a black stone!
Your stomach refuses to eat a velvet book tied with blue ribbon!
Your stomach refuses to eat a small first-aid kit!
Your stomach refuses to eat a milky potion of see invisible!
Your stomach refuses to eat a small wooden chest!
Your stomach refuses to eat a waterskin!
Your stomach refuses to eat a large first-aid kit!
You eat a large piece of pork chop.
It tastes a little old.
There is nothing left now.
You eat a large piece of pork chop.
You are full.
You are too full to eat more!
Your stomach refuses to eat a waterskin!

Your stomach refuses to eat a waterskin!

609H 48V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW>
Zug flies south.
Epso flies south.
You follow Zug south.
Lashe flies in from the north.
Vittu flies in from the north.
Sharmaine flies in from the north.
Northern Road
The stone tiles of this road have long since lost their form and
structure: the road here is uneven and cracked, even missing in some parts.
Broken stone and gravel speckle the road, causing each footfall to create
an eery "crunching" sound. The main road runs north, towards the city
gates, and south, towards the fountain and city square. A smaller road
leads eastward towards the market.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

Lashe flies in from the north.
Vittu flies in from the north.
Sharmaine flies in from the north.
Northern Road
The city square lies just to the south, where the sounds of children
laughing and other familiar city sounds filled the air. Now there is an
eery silence, save for the noises that you make. This road runs
north-south, joining the cities fountain with the it's northern gate, while
a narrow street leads east, towards the remains of an important looking
building.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

Lashe flies in from the north.
Vittu flies in from the north.
Sharmaine flies in from the north.
Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the city.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)

Eastern Road
Weeds separated and broken through the stone tiles that once made up
this road, but even those weeds have long since died away. Each footfall
echoes through the shattered, skeletal remains of the buildings to the
north. All that remains of the southeastern corner of the city is a huge,
ominous crater.

The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with rubble.

609H 41V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW>
Zug flies west.
Epso flies west.
You follow Zug west.
Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
Sharmaine flies in from the east.
Before the Bank
The broken road leading to the cities bank crunches and cracks beneath
your feet. Having survived the chaos and destruction that took this city to
ruin, then withstanding the gradual decay of time has left this road in a
dismal state of ruin. Small chips of stone and gravel crunch beneath your
feet and the floor is cracked and broken in several places, leaving the
floor very uneven and difficult to traverse.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)

Northern Road
The stone tiles of this road have long since lost their form and
structure: the road here is uneven and cracked, even missing in some parts.
Broken stone and gravel speckle the road, causing each footfall to create
an eery "crunching" sound. The main road runs north, towards the city
gates, and south, towards the fountain and city square. A smaller road
leads eastward towards the market.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

Northern Road
The city square lies just to the south, where the sounds of children
laughing and other familiar city sounds filled the air. Now there is an
eery silence, save for the noises that you make. This road runs
north-south, joining the cities fountain with the it's northern gate, while
a narrow street leads east, towards the remains of an important looking
building.

Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the city.

buildings, most of them empty shells or heaps of rubble.

Near the Tarsis Wastelands
The broken road continues westward, towards the Tarsis Wastelands which
was once known for the vagrants and criminals that occupied the area. Now
it, like the rest of the city, is barren and desolate. A road branches off
to the south, leading towards the cities inn, while the main road leads
eastward, towards the city square.

The Tarsis Wastelands
Once, these Wastelands served as a walking ground for muggers,
prostitutes, thieves and the like, but now it is dead and barren. The
remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the south,
but it had collapsed onto itself a long time ago, destroying whatever might
have been in it.

Lashe flies in from the north.
Vittu flies in from the north.
Sharmaine flies in from the north.
The Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

609H 20V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW>
Zug flies south.
Epso flies south.
You follow Zug south.
Lashe flies in from the north.
Vittu flies in from the north.
Sharmaine flies in from the north.
A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates. These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)

. . . has a metallic luster.

<worn on body> a thin sheet of hardened granite..it hums softly
<worn on head> an adamantite helmet
<worn on legs> a pair of unfinished mithril legplates..it hums softly
<worn on feet> a pair of black climbing talons
<worn on hands> a pair of spiked sterling gauntlets
<worn on arms> some red dragon scale sleeves
<worn as shield> a wooden shield of dragons
<worn about body> a minotaur's weapons harness
<worn about waist> a spiked leather warbelt
<worn around right wrist> a band of power
<worn around left wrist> a diamond studded dog collar
<used in primary hand> a dwarven morningstar
<held in secondary hand> a black stone

665H 55V 13822X 1712C Exits:N> lA Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates. These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.
Vespin, Deity of Idling is standing here. (red aura)
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

665H 55V 13822X 1712C Exits:N> flyYou're already flying!

665H 55V 13822X 1712C Exits:N>
Zug flies north.
Epso flies north.
You follow Zug north.
Lashe flies in from the south.
Vittu flies in from the south.
Sharmaine flies in from the south.
A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the Tarsis
wastelands to the west.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

665H 54V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW>
Zug flies east.
Epso flies east.
You follow Zug east.
Lashe flies in from the west.
Vittu flies in from the west.
Sharmaine flies in from the west.
Forgotten Stables
The eastern half of this huge building has collapsed onto itself,
leaving half of the stables buried and unusable. Most of the horse stalls
have been destroyed or fallen to ruin. This chamber has not seen a horse
for several ages, but the smells normally associated with horses still
lingers here.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

Fallen buildings, ruined archways and shattered stone are all that
remain of the road here. The road extends west, towards the Tarsis
Wastelands, and east towards the cities gate.

A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

Southern Road
A massive, charred crater is all that remains of the southeastern part
of the city. Whatever struck this city and left it in its ruined state must
have rivaled the destructive force of the Cataclysm to have levelled this
large a section of the city. Despite it's poor condition, the road leading
west is in much better condition than the road that once lead eastward.

Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the city.

Northern Road
The city square lies just to the south, where the sounds of children
laughing and other familiar city sounds filled the air. Now there is an
eery silence, save for the noises that you make. This road runs
north-south, joining the cities fountain with the it's northern gate, while
a narrow street leads east, towards the remains of an important looking
building.

Before the Courthouse
The building to the south once served as the city hall and courthouse
for Tarsis. Even now, in its dilapidated state, the building still has an
air of importance and authority. One of the main city roads lies to the
west, while the road leads eastward, towards the cities former markets.

The Ruined Market
Broken stone tiles crunch under your feet; the massive stone tiles that
once endured the footfalls of men and horses alike lie shattered and broken
here. The surrounding buildings are in the same condition: several have
missing walls and roofs while others have entirely collapsed onto
themselves.

The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with rubble.

Wall Road
Once there was an immense lookout tower at the northeast corner of
Tarsis that provided city guards with a vantage point to survey the
surrounding landscape. That tower collapsed inward, into the city, bringing
a large section of the city wall with it. The entire road leading east is
blocked by the fallen stone and rubble now, the only exits are a road
leading south into the market, and west towards the northern gate.

North Gate
The northern gate of Tarsis once stood as an inpenetrable boundary to
would-be attackers from the Plains of Dust. Guards would patrol this area
and often and protected the cities inhabitants from the nomads and common
criminals that dwelled within the Plains. Now the shattered gate stands as
an eternal testament to their failure: the gate itself has long been torn
out of its frame and shattered onto the stone road of the city.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

access to the tower.

fence and gate that used to separate the park from the city. The grass that
once bordered the path into the park has been replaced by dust while the
path itself has been broken by weeds.

Before the Library
Two large wooden double doors in the southern wall once opened to
scholars seeking the knowledge and wisdom that was housed within the Great
Tarsis Library. Now only a single, beaten door remains, barely hanging from
its rusted hinges, threatening to fall and shatter itself on the stone
floor. The wall to the north is a crumbling testament to the power of time
and neglect: what was once relied upon to protect the city from invaders is
little more than a mound of stones that a small child could surmount.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

A Shattered Road
The state of the road has long since fallen from its former grace. This
once busy, bustling market road has seen few travelers in recent times.
Skeletons of the buildings that once bordered the road are all that is
left, save the restaurant to the east that has somehow, miraculously
survived all this time.

Pierre's Fine Tarsis Ham
Somehow, this restaurant has survived the devastation, destruction and
decay of time and remains as immaculate as the day it was last seen on
Krynn. The fragrant scent of ham still lingers in the air, making your
mouth water and your stomach growl. Some divine power has protected this
place, and for reasons unknown to you, this place feels very important.

Eastern Road
Weeds separated and broken through the stone tiles that once made up
this road, but even those weeds have long since died away. Each footfall
echoes through the shattered, skeletal remains of the buildings to the
north. All that remains of the southeastern corner of the city is a huge,
ominous crater.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)

Sharmaine flies in from the west.
East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)

Wall Road
All that is left of the road to the north is a huge pile of rubble. The
outer city wall has fallen inward, blocking the path to the north. A small
road leads west, into the marketplace, and the cities east gate is just a
short distance south from here.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
