Vittu flies in from the east.
Sharmaine flies in from the east.
The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with rubble.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)

The Ruined Market
Broken stone tiles crunch under your feet; the massive stone tiles that
once endured the footfalls of men and horses alike lie shattered and broken
here. The surrounding buildings are in the same condition: several have
missing walls and roofs while others have entirely collapsed onto
themselves.

Before the Courthouse
The building to the south once served as the city hall and courthouse
for Tarsis. Even now, in its dilapidated state, the building still has an
air of importance and authority. One of the main city roads lies to the
west, while the road leads eastward, towards the cities former markets.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)

Northern Road
The city square lies just to the south, where the sounds of children
laughing and other familiar city sounds filled the air. Now there is an
eery silence, save for the noises that you make. This road runs
north-south, joining the cities fountain with the it's northern gate, while
a narrow street leads east, towards the remains of an important looking
building.

Northern Road
The stone tiles of this road have long since lost their form and
structure: the road here is uneven and cracked, even missing in some parts.
Broken stone and gravel speckle the road, causing each footfall to create
an eery "crunching" sound. The main road runs north, towards the city
gates, and south, towards the fountain and city square. A smaller road
leads eastward towards the market.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

Lashe flies in from the south.

Sharmaine flies in from the south.
North Gate
The northern gate of Tarsis once stood as an inpenetrable boundary to
would-be attackers from the Plains of Dust. Guards would patrol this area
and often and protected the cities inhabitants from the nomads and common
criminals that dwelled within the Plains. Now the shattered gate stands as
an eternal testament to their failure: the gate itself has long been torn
out of its frame and shattered onto the stone road of the city.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)

A Fallen Guardpost
Remnants of the guard tower still sit atop the walls of the city here,
although not nearly enough to remain usable. Splinters of wood are all that
remains of the supporting beams and the ladder that were once used to gain
access to the tower.

Forgotten Stables
The eastern half of this huge building has collapsed onto itself,
leaving half of the stables buried and unusable. Most of the horse stalls
have been destroyed or fallen to ruin. This chamber has not seen a horse
for several ages, but the smells normally associated with horses still
lingers here.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates. These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)

linger here for some time still to come.

The Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

The Tarsis Wastelands
Once, these Wastelands served as a walking ground for muggers,
prostitutes, thieves and the like, but now it is dead and barren. The
remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the south,
but it had collapsed onto itself a long time ago, destroying whatever might
have been in it.

Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the city.

Western Road
Large cracks in the stone tiles of the road indicate that the
foundation this road was set on has shifted and changed over time. This
road leads east to the cities fountain, and westwards towards the Tarsis
wastelands.

This road runs east-west, from the Tarsis fountain towards the
wastelands. A small road leads north from here, past the old Tarsis temple
and towards the park. Immediately to the south is a row of broken
buildings, most of them empty shells or heaps of rubble.

Near the Tarsis Wastelands
The broken road continues westward, towards the Tarsis Wastelands which
was once known for the vagrants and criminals that occupied the area. Now
it, like the rest of the city, is barren and desolate. A road branches off
to the south, leading towards the cities inn, while the main road leads
eastward, towards the city square.

The Tarsis Wastelands
Once, these Wastelands served as a walking ground for muggers,
prostitutes, thieves and the like, but now it is dead and barren. The
remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the south,
but it had collapsed onto itself a long time ago, destroying whatever might
have been in it.

665H 57V 13822X 1712C Exits:NES>
Zug flies south.
Epso flies south.
You follow Zug south.
Lashe flies in from the north.
Vittu flies in from the north.
Sharmaine flies in from the north.
The Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

linger here for some time still to come.

A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

665H 49V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW>
Zug flies south.
Epso flies south.
You follow Zug south.
Lashe flies in from the north.
Vittu flies in from the north.
Sharmaine flies in from the north.
A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates. These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.

Forgotten Stables
The eastern half of this huge building has collapsed onto itself,
leaving half of the stables buried and unusable. Most of the horse stalls
have been destroyed or fallen to ruin. This chamber has not seen a horse
for several ages, but the smells normally associated with horses still
lingers here.

Southern Road
A massive, charred crater is all that remains of the southeastern part
of the city. Whatever struck this city and left it in its ruined state must
have rivaled the destructive force of the Cataclysm to have levelled this
large a section of the city. Despite it's poor condition, the road leading
west is in much better condition than the road that once lead eastward.

A massive, charred crater is all that remains of the southeastern part
of the city. Whatever struck this city and left it in its ruined state must
have rivaled the destructive force of the Cataclysm to have levelled this
large a section of the city. Despite it's poor condition, the road leading
west is in much better condition than the road that once lead eastward.

roofs have collapsed. This city has fallen far from its former grace.

Before the Forge
Once, many warriors frequented this section of town. Between the
weapons shop to the south, the inn just a short distance to the west and
the bar to the north, everything a young warrior needed could be found
here. Now, the only thing left of the building to the north is a pile of
rubble and the shop to the south has long since been deserted.

mostly intact. The sign that once hung above the inns door has nearly
fallen from its perch: it hangs by a single hook now, ready to fall and
shatter itself onto the cobblestone road.

The Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the south,
but it had collapsed onto itself a long time ago, destroying whatever might
have been in it.

423H 77V 13822X 1712C [Kilians:Fair] [Javi:V.Good] Exits:ES> You flee head over heels.
The Tarsis Wastelands
The smell of filth still lingers in the air here, a remnant of the
cities dump that rests just a short distance to the south. A short distance
to the northeast, you can make out a wagon in this desert wasteland.

423H 75V 13822X 1712C Exits:NES> eThe Tarsis Wastelands
A small wagon rests just north of here, and although the paint has
faded, it still shows a myriad of color. This wagon once belonged to a
gypsy fortune teller, although there are no signs of any life around here
anymore.

423H 73V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> wThe Tarsis Wastelands
The smell of filth still lingers in the air here, a remnant of the
cities dump that rests just a short distance to the south. A short distance
to the northeast, you can make out a wagon in this desert wasteland.

423H 71V 13822X 1712C Exits:NES> sThe Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.

423H 69V 13822X 1712C Exits:NE>

cities dump that rests just a short distance to the south. A short distance
to the northeast, you can make out a wagon in this desert wasteland.

423H 67V 13822X 1712C Exits:NES> nThe Tarsis Wastelands
Clouds of dry dust and sand fill the air, stirred up from every
footstep, making it difficult to breath. There is almost nothing to see in
this area, save the fallen city of Tarsis to the east.

481H 65V 13822X 1712C [Zug:Good] [Delvar:V.Good] Exits:ES> fleYou flee head over heels.
The Tarsis Wastelands
Once, these Wastelands served as a walking ground for muggers,
prostitutes, thieves and the like, but now it is dead and barren. The
remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the south,
but it had collapsed onto itself a long time ago, destroying whatever might
have been in it.
Kogi the Male Minitaur is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Fernar, Myth with a Big Shield and a Hacky is standing here.
A bronze dragon is sitting here.

481H 63V 13822X 1712C Exits:EW> eNear the Tarsis Wastelands
The broken road continues westward, towards the Tarsis Wastelands which
was once known for the vagrants and criminals that occupied the area. Now
it, like the rest of the city, is barren and desolate. A road branches off
to the south, leading towards the cities inn, while the main road leads
eastward, towards the city square.

The Tarsis Wastelands
Once, these Wastelands served as a walking ground for muggers,
prostitutes, thieves and the like, but now it is dead and barren. The
remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the south,

464H 83V 13822X 1712C Exits:ES> eThe Tarsis Wastelands
Once, these Wastelands served as a walking ground for muggers,
prostitutes, thieves and the like, but now it is dead and barren. The
remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the south,
but it had collapsed onto itself a long time ago, destroying whatever might
have been in it.

464H 81V 13822X 1712C Exits:EW> eNear the Tarsis Wastelands
The broken road continues westward, towards the Tarsis Wastelands which
was once known for the vagrants and criminals that occupied the area. Now
it, like the rest of the city, is barren and desolate. A road branches off
to the south, leading towards the cities inn, while the main road leads
eastward, towards the city square.
Luze, Master of Losses is standing here.

464H 79V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW> eWestern Road
This road runs east-west, from the Tarsis fountain towards the
wastelands. A small road leads north from here, past the old Tarsis temple
and towards the park. Immediately to the south is a row of broken
buildings, most of them empty shells or heaps of rubble.
Jvails Kindheart, Shifty-Eyed Saint is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a tough exterior.

464H 78V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW> sAlas, you cannot go that way...

464H 78V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW> eWestern Road
Large cracks in the stone tiles of the road indicate that the
foundation this road was set on has shifted and changed over time. This
road leads east to the cities fountain, and westwards towards the Tarsis
wastelands.

464H 77V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW> eOld Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the city.

464H 76V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW> eEastern Road
Weeds separated and broken through the stone tiles that once made up
this road, but even those weeds have long since died away. Each footfall
echoes through the shattered, skeletal remains of the buildings to the
north. All that remains of the southeastern corner of the city is a huge,
ominous crater.

464H 75V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW> eEast Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.

464H 74V 13822X 1712C Exits:NW> nWall Road
All that is left of the road to the north is a huge pile of rubble. The
outer city wall has fallen inward, blocking the path to the north. A small
road leads west, into the marketplace, and the cities east gate is just a
short distance south from here.

464H 73V 13822X 1712C Exits:SW> eAlas, you cannot go that way...

464H 73V 13822X 1712C Exits:SW> sEast Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.

464H 72V 13822X 1712C Exits:NW> wEastern Road
Weeds separated and broken through the stone tiles that once made up
this road, but even those weeds have long since died away. Each footfall
echoes through the shattered, skeletal remains of the buildings to the
north. All that remains of the southeastern corner of the city is a huge,
ominous crater.

464H 71V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW> sAlas, you cannot go that way...

464H 71V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW> nA Shattered Road
The state of the road has long since fallen from its former grace. This
once busy, bustling market road has seen few travelers in recent times.
Skeletons of the buildings that once bordered the road are all that is
left, save the restaurant to the east that has somehow, miraculously
survived all this time.

464H 70V 13822X 1712C Exits:NES> nThe Ruined Market
Broken stone tiles crunch under your feet; the massive stone tiles that
once endured the footfalls of men and horses alike lie shattered and broken
here. The surrounding buildings are in the same condition: several have
missing walls and roofs while others have entirely collapsed onto
themselves.

464H 69V 13822X 1712C Exits:NSW> nThe Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with rubble.

464H 68V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> nWall Road
Once there was an immense lookout tower at the northeast corner of
Tarsis that provided city guards with a vantage point to survey the
surrounding landscape. That tower collapsed inward, into the city, bringing
a large section of the city wall with it. The entire road leading east is
blocked by the fallen stone and rubble now, the only exits are a road
leading south into the market, and west towards the northern gate.

464H 67V 13822X 1712C Exits:SW> nAlas, you cannot go that way...

464H 67V 13822X 1712C Exits:SW> GT tick in 10wYou tell your group 'tick in 10'

464H 67V 13822X 1712C Exits:SW> North Gate
The northern gate of Tarsis once stood as an inpenetrable boundary to
would-be attackers from the Plains of Dust. Guards would patrol this area
and often and protected the cities inhabitants from the nomads and common
criminals that dwelled within the Plains. Now the shattered gate stands as
an eternal testament to their failure: the gate itself has long been torn
out of its frame and shattered onto the stone road of the city.

464H 66V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW> nAlas, you cannot go that way...

464H 66V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW> wA Fallen Guardpost
Remnants of the guard tower still sit atop the walls of the city here,
although not nearly enough to remain usable. Splinters of wood are all that
remains of the supporting beams and the ladder that were once used to gain
access to the tower.

464H 65V 13822X 1712C Exits:EW> wThe Northern Park Entrance
Twisted, crushed iron, painted in rust, is all that remains of the
fence and gate that used to separate the park from the city. The grass that
once bordered the path into the park has been replaced by dust while the
path itself has been broken by weeds.

464H 64V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW> sA Path Through the Park
Whats left of the Tarsis park extends east and west from here, although
only a short distance to the west. The trees here have long-since died
away, only a few withering stumps remain as a reminder of the plant life
that once flourished here.

464H 62V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> wOverlooking the Cratered Park
This narrow ledge overlooks the huge crater that has replaced nearly
the entire western half of the park. The soil is still charred and burned
and you see no signs of life at all within the crater. The only exit from
this ledge is back east, towards the remainder of the park.

Whats left of the Tarsis park extends east and west from here, although
only a short distance to the west. The trees here have long-since died
away, only a few withering stumps remain as a reminder of the plant life
that once flourished here.

369H 83V 13822X 1712C Exits:E> eA Path Through the Park
Whats left of the Tarsis park extends east and west from here, although
only a short distance to the west. The trees here have long-since died
away, only a few withering stumps remain as a reminder of the plant life
that once flourished here.

369H 81V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> sA Path Through the Park
This dry, dusty pathy leads north-south through the old Tarsis park.
This park was once full of life, a lush, vibrant forest rich with color and
sound, but now it is a desolate, lonely place. The entire west half of the
park has been replaced with a giant crater.

369H 79V 13822X 1712C Exits:NES> sBefore the Temple
Dry dust and sand have settled on the floor of the road here, stirring
up into small clouds with every footstep. The once-lush Tarsis Park lies in
ruin to the north, and the entrance to the cities temple is to the west.

369H 77V 13822X 1712C Exits:NSW> sWestern Road
This road runs east-west, from the Tarsis fountain towards the
wastelands. A small road leads north from here, past the old Tarsis temple
and towards the park. Immediately to the south is a row of broken
buildings, most of them empty shells or heaps of rubble.

369H 76V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW> sAlas, you cannot go that way...

369H 76V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW> eWestern Road
Large cracks in the stone tiles of the road indicate that the
foundation this road was set on has shifted and changed over time. This
road leads east to the cities fountain, and westwards towards the Tarsis
wastelands.

369H 75V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW> eOld Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the city.

369H 74V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW> eEastern Road
Weeds separated and broken through the stone tiles that once made up
this road, but even those weeds have long since died away. Each footfall
echoes through the shattered, skeletal remains of the buildings to the
north. All that remains of the southeastern corner of the city is a huge,
ominous crater.

369H 73V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW> eEast Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.

369H 72V 13822X 1712C Exits:NW> wEastern Road
Weeds separated and broken through the stone tiles that once made up
this road, but even those weeds have long since died away. Each footfall
echoes through the shattered, skeletal remains of the buildings to the
north. All that remains of the southeastern corner of the city is a huge,
ominous crater.

369H 69V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW> sA Broken Road
Broken stone tile and long dead weeds litter this street. The buildings
bordering the street have all fallen to ruin: entire walls are missing,
roofs have collapsed. This city has fallen far from its former grace.

369H 68V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW> sAlas, you cannot go that way...

369H 68V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW> eSouthern Road
A massive, charred crater is all that remains of the southeastern part
of the city. Whatever struck this city and left it in its ruined state must
have rivaled the destructive force of the Cataclysm to have levelled this
large a section of the city. Despite it's poor condition, the road leading
west is in much better condition than the road that once lead eastward.

369H 67V 13822X 1712C Exits:NSW> eAlas, you cannot go that way...

369H 67V 13822X 1712C Exits:NSW> sA Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

369H 66V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> sA Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates. These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.
Daniel is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
. . . has a tough exterior.

The Tarsis Wastelands
The faint smell of decaying trash wafts in from the west on an unfelt
breeze. Although the city has long since been abandonned and deserted,
leaving the dump unused, the prominent smell of garbage will probably
linger here for some time still to come.

The Tarsis Wastelands
The faint smell of decaying trash wafts in from the west on an unfelt
breeze. Although the city has long since been abandonned and deserted,
leaving the dump unused, the prominent smell of garbage will probably
linger here for some time still to come.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)

651H 70V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW>
Epso flies west.
You follow Epso west.
Sharmaine flies in from the east.
The Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.

The Tarsis Wastelands
Once, these Wastelands served as a walking ground for muggers,
prostitutes, thieves and the like, but now it is dead and barren. The
remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the south,
but it had collapsed onto itself a long time ago, destroying whatever might
have been in it.

Near the Tarsis Wastelands

to the south, leading towards the cities inn, while the main road leads
eastward, towards the city square.

of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the city.

395H 71V 13822X 1712C Exits:NSW> wWithin the Broken Temple
This large, now-empty chamber once served as the entryway into the
Tarsis temple. The floor, once a polished, shiny marble, is dull and
cracked, having lost it's sheen long ago. There is a chamber to the north
that served as the clerics guild, and the exit to the temple lies to the
east.

. . . is outlined with a dim aura.

395H 70V 13822X 1712C Exits:NE> nThe Clerics Guild
Young clerics and priests once travelled long distances to come here to
study and worship. An elaborate altar was once the centerpiece of this
chamber, but now it is gone and no one has visited or worshipped here in
ages. The marble floor is cracked and uneven in several places, but still
this room has a feeling of divinity and importance.

395H 65V 13822X 1712C Exits:NSW> nA Path Through the Park
This dry, dusty pathy leads north-south through the old Tarsis park.
This park was once full of life, a lush, vibrant forest rich with color and
sound, but now it is a desolate, lonely place. The entire west half of the
park has been replaced with a giant crater.

away, only a few withering stumps remain as a reminder of the plant life
that once flourished here.

395H 61V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> The Northern Park Entrance

193H 53V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW> wThe Tarsis Wastelands
Once, these Wastelands served as a walking ground for muggers,
prostitutes, thieves and the like, but now it is dead and barren. The
remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the south,
but it had collapsed onto itself a long time ago, destroying whatever might
have been in it.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
A bronze dragon is sitting here.

193H 51V 13822X 1712C Exits:EW> eNear the Tarsis Wastelands
The broken road continues westward, towards the Tarsis Wastelands which
was once known for the vagrants and criminals that occupied the area. Now
it, like the rest of the city, is barren and desolate. A road branches off
to the south, leading towards the cities inn, while the main road leads
eastward, towards the city square.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

215H 50V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> eForgotten Stables
The eastern half of this huge building has collapsed onto itself,
leaving half of the stables buried and unusable. Most of the horse stalls
have been destroyed or fallen to ruin. This chamber has not seen a horse
for several ages, but the smells normally associated with horses still
lingers here.

Zug tells your group 'east part?'

215H 44V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW> wAlas, you cannot go that way...

215H 44V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW> The Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

215H 42V 13822X 1712C Exits:NE>
Sharmaine flies north.
You follow Sharmaine north.
The Tarsis Wastelands
The smell of filth still lingers in the air here, a remnant of the
cities dump that rests just a short distance to the south. A short distance
to the northeast, you can make out a wagon in this desert wasteland.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

215H 40V 13822X 1712C Exits:NES>
Sharmaine flies north.
You follow Sharmaine north.
The Tarsis Wastelands
Clouds of dry dust and sand fill the air, stirred up from every
footstep, making it difficult to breath. There is almost nothing to see in
this area, save the fallen city of Tarsis to the east.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

215H 32V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW>
Sharmaine flies east.
You follow Sharmaine east.
Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the city.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

215H 31V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW>
A flash of lightning announces the storm's arrival.

233H 55V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW>
Sharmaine flies east.
You follow Sharmaine east.
Eastern Road
Weeds separated and broken through the stone tiles that once made up
this road, but even those weeds have long since died away. Each footfall
echoes through the shattered, skeletal remains of the buildings to the
north. All that remains of the southeastern corner of the city is a huge,
ominous crater.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

233H 54V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW> l
Sharmaine flies east.
You follow Sharmaine east.
East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

233H 53V 13822X 1712C Exits:NW> East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

233H 53V 13822X 1712C Exits:NW>
Sharmaine flies north.
You follow Sharmaine north.
Wall Road
All that is left of the road to the north is a huge pile of rubble. The
outer city wall has fallen inward, blocking the path to the north. A small
road leads west, into the marketplace, and the cities east gate is just a
short distance south from here.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

233H 50V 13822X 1712C Exits:SW>
Sharmaine flies west.
You follow Sharmaine west.
The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with rubble.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

233H 49V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW>

233H 49V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW>
Sharmaine flies west.
You follow Sharmaine west.
Before the Bank
The broken road leading to the cities bank crunches and cracks beneath
your feet. Having survived the chaos and destruction that took this city to
ruin, then withstanding the gradual decay of time has left this road in a
dismal state of ruin. Small chips of stone and gravel crunch beneath your
feet and the floor is cracked and broken in several places, leaving the
floor very uneven and difficult to traverse.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

233H 48V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW>
Sharmaine flies west.
You follow Sharmaine west.
Northern Road
The stone tiles of this road have long since lost their form and
structure: the road here is uneven and cracked, even missing in some parts.
Broken stone and gravel speckle the road, causing each footfall to create
an eery "crunching" sound. The main road runs north, towards the city
gates, and south, towards the fountain and city square. A smaller road
leads eastward towards the market.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

233H 47V 13822X 1712C Exits:NES>
Sharmaine flies south.
You follow Sharmaine south.
Northern Road
The city square lies just to the south, where the sounds of children
laughing and other familiar city sounds filled the air. Now there is an
eery silence, save for the noises that you make. This road runs
north-south, joining the cities fountain with the it's northern gate, while
a narrow street leads east, towards the remains of an important looking
building.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

Before the Temple
Dry dust and sand have settled on the floor of the road here, stirring
up into small clouds with every footstep. The once-lush Tarsis Park lies in

You follow Sharmaine east.
Western Road
Large cracks in the stone tiles of the road indicate that the
foundation this road was set on has shifted and changed over time. This
road leads east to the cities fountain, and westwards towards the Tarsis
wastelands.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

233H 40V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW>
Sharmaine flies east.
You follow Sharmaine east.
Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the city.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

233H 39V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW>
Sharmaine flies east.
You follow Sharmaine east.
Eastern Road
Weeds separated and broken through the stone tiles that once made up
this road, but even those weeds have long since died away. Each footfall
echoes through the shattered, skeletal remains of the buildings to the
north. All that remains of the southeastern corner of the city is a huge,
ominous crater.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

233H 38V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW>
Sharmaine flies north.
You follow Sharmaine north.
A Shattered Road
The state of the road has long since fallen from its former grace. This
once busy, bustling market road has seen few travelers in recent times.
Skeletons of the buildings that once bordered the road are all that is
left, save the restaurant to the east that has somehow, miraculously
survived all this time.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

233H 37V 13822X 1712C Exits:NES>
Sharmaine flies north.
You follow Sharmaine north.
The Ruined Market
Broken stone tiles crunch under your feet; the massive stone tiles that
once endured the footfalls of men and horses alike lie shattered and broken
here. The surrounding buildings are in the same condition: several have
missing walls and roofs while others have entirely collapsed onto
themselves.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

233H 36V 13822X 1712C Exits:NSW>
Sharmaine flies north.
You follow Sharmaine north.
The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with rubble.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

233H 35V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW>
Sharmaine flies north.
You follow Sharmaine north.
Wall Road
Once there was an immense lookout tower at the northeast corner of
Tarsis that provided city guards with a vantage point to survey the
surrounding landscape. That tower collapsed inward, into the city, bringing
a large section of the city wall with it. The entire road leading east is
blocked by the fallen stone and rubble now, the only exits are a road
leading south into the market, and west towards the northern gate.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

233H 34V 13822X 1712C Exits:SW>
Sharmaine flies west.
You follow Sharmaine west.
North Gate
The northern gate of Tarsis once stood as an inpenetrable boundary to
would-be attackers from the Plains of Dust. Guards would patrol this area
and often and protected the cities inhabitants from the nomads and common
criminals that dwelled within the Plains. Now the shattered gate stands as
an eternal testament to their failure: the gate itself has long been torn
out of its frame and shattered onto the stone road of the city.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

233H 33V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW>
Sharmaine flies west.
You follow Sharmaine west.
A Fallen Guardpost
Remnants of the guard tower still sit atop the walls of the city here,
although not nearly enough to remain usable. Splinters of wood are all that
remains of the supporting beams and the ladder that were once used to gain
access to the tower.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

233H 32V 13822X 1712C Exits:EW>
Sharmaine flies west.
You follow Sharmaine west.
The Northern Park Entrance
Twisted, crushed iron, painted in rust, is all that remains of the
fence and gate that used to separate the park from the city. The grass that
once bordered the path into the park has been replaced by dust while the
path itself has been broken by weeds.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

233H 31V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW>
Sharmaine flies west.
You follow Sharmaine west.
Before the Library
Two large wooden double doors in the southern wall once opened to
scholars seeking the knowledge and wisdom that was housed within the Great
Tarsis Library. Now only a single, beaten door remains, barely hanging from
its rusted hinges, threatening to fall and shatter itself on the stone
floor. The wall to the north is a crumbling testament to the power of time
and neglect: what was once relied upon to protect the city from invaders is
little more than a mound of stones that a small child could surmount.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

233H 30V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW>
Sharmaine flies west.
You follow Sharmaine west.
The Back Alley
Even though the walls of the city are crumbling and large portions of
it are missing, this back-alley is still cast in shadows. Various thugs
once frequented this place, preying on hapless library-goers that had lost
their way. The library itself rests to the south, a shattered, pathetic
shell of its former glory.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

Sharmaine flies east.
You follow Sharmaine east.
East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

outer city wall has fallen inward, blocking the path to the north. A small
road leads west, into the marketplace, and the cities east gate is just a
short distance south from here.

Before the Bank
The broken road leading to the cities bank crunches and cracks beneath
your feet. Having survived the chaos and destruction that took this city to
ruin, then withstanding the gradual decay of time has left this road in a
dismal state of ruin. Small chips of stone and gravel crunch beneath your
feet and the floor is cracked and broken in several places, leaving the
floor very uneven and difficult to traverse.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

Northern Road

gates, and south, towards the fountain and city square. A smaller road
leads eastward towards the market.

Near the Tarsis Wastelands
The broken road continues westward, towards the Tarsis Wastelands which
was once known for the vagrants and criminals that occupied the area. Now
it, like the rest of the city, is barren and desolate. A road branches off
to the south, leading towards the cities inn, while the main road leads
eastward, towards the city square.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

Outside the Tarsis Inn
The Tarsis Inn, to the west, is one of the few buildings that remains
mostly intact. The sign that once hung above the inns door has nearly
fallen from its perch: it hangs by a single hook now, ready to fall and
shatter itself onto the cobblestone road.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

A Ruined Inn
The lobby of the inn is barren and empty, save the single large
receptionists desk. The stairs leading up to the inns bedrooms have been
crushed under rubble and are no longer usable, but you doubt there would be
anything worthy of note in the rooms above.

A Ruined Inn
The lobby of the inn is barren and empty, save the single large
receptionists desk. The stairs leading up to the inns bedrooms have been
crushed under rubble and are no longer usable, but you doubt there would be
anything worthy of note in the rooms above.

Forgotten Stables
The eastern half of this huge building has collapsed onto itself,
leaving half of the stables buried and unusable. Most of the horse stalls
have been destroyed or fallen to ruin. This chamber has not seen a horse
for several ages, but the smells normally associated with horses still
lingers here.
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

701H 86V 13822X 1712C Exits:W> stYou are already standing.

701H 86V 13822X 1712C Exits:W>
Zug flies west.
Sharmaine flies west.
You follow Zug west.
Epso flies in from the east.
Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the Tarsis
wastelands to the west.
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

701H 85V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW>
Zug flies south.
Sharmaine flies south.
You follow Zug south.
Epso flies in from the north.
Lashe flies in from the north.
Vittu flies in from the north.
A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates. These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)

A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

The Tarsis Wastelands
The faint smell of decaying trash wafts in from the west on an unfelt
breeze. Although the city has long since been abandonned and deserted,
leaving the dump unused, the prominent smell of garbage will probably
linger here for some time still to come.

701H 79V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW>
Zug flies west.
Sharmaine flies west.
You follow Zug west.
Epso flies in from the east.
Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
The Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)

Forgotten Stables
The eastern half of this huge building has collapsed onto itself,
leaving half of the stables buried and unusable. Most of the horse stalls
have been destroyed or fallen to ruin. This chamber has not seen a horse
for several ages, but the smells normally associated with horses still
lingers here.

701H 61V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW>
Zug flies south.
Sharmaine flies south.
You follow Zug south.
Epso flies in from the north.
Lashe flies in from the north.
Vittu flies in from the north.
A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates. These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.

550H 84V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates. These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)

550H 83V 13822X 1712C Exits:N>
Vittu flies in from the north.

550H 83V 13822X 1712C Exits:N>
Zug flies north.
Sharmaine flies north.
You follow Zug north.
Epso flies in from the south.
Lashe flies in from the south.
Vittu flies in from the south.
A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the Tarsis
wastelands to the west.
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

Sharmaine flies east.
You follow Zug east.
Epso flies in from the west.
Lashe flies in from the west.
Vittu flies in from the west.
Forgotten Stables
The eastern half of this huge building has collapsed onto itself,
leaving half of the stables buried and unusable. Most of the horse stalls
have been destroyed or fallen to ruin. This chamber has not seen a horse
for several ages, but the smells normally associated with horses still
lingers here.
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates. These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.

550H 79V 13822X 1712C Exits:N> lA Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates. These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is resting here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is resting here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is resting here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

Near the Tarsis Wastelands
Dry dust stirs into small clouds with every step you take. The road
here appears to be unfinished, the stone tiles give way to dirt and sand as
it approaches the wastelands. There air here is dry, and there is an
unnerving stillness here.

Forgotten Stables
The eastern half of this huge building has collapsed onto itself,
leaving half of the stables buried and unusable. Most of the horse stalls
have been destroyed or fallen to ruin. This chamber has not seen a horse
for several ages, but the smells normally associated with horses still
lingers here.

Southern Road
A massive, charred crater is all that remains of the southeastern part
of the city. Whatever struck this city and left it in its ruined state must
have rivaled the destructive force of the Cataclysm to have levelled this
large a section of the city. Despite it's poor condition, the road leading
west is in much better condition than the road that once lead eastward.

Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the city.

Eastern Road
Weeds separated and broken through the stone tiles that once made up
this road, but even those weeds have long since died away. Each footfall
echoes through the shattered, skeletal remains of the buildings to the
north. All that remains of the southeastern corner of the city is a huge,
ominous crater.
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)

. . . is outlined with a dim aura.

. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

Epso flies in from the west.
Lashe flies in from the west.
Vittu flies in from the west.
East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.

road leads west, into the marketplace, and the cities east gate is just a
short distance south from here.

The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with rubble.

Wall Road
Once there was an immense lookout tower at the northeast corner of
Tarsis that provided city guards with a vantage point to survey the
surrounding landscape. That tower collapsed inward, into the city, bringing
a large section of the city wall with it. The entire road leading east is
bas kogiblocked by the fallen stone and rubble now, the only exits are a road
leading south into the market, and west towards the northern gate.

Zug flies west.
Sharmaine flies west.
You follow Zug west.
Epso flies in from the east.
Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
North Gate
The northern gate of Tarsis once stood as an inpenetrable boundary to
would-be attackers from the Plains of Dust. Guards would patrol this area
and often and protected the cities inhabitants from the nomads and common
criminals that dwelled within the Plains. Now the shattered gate stands as
an eternal testament to their failure: the gate itself has long been torn
out of its frame and shattered onto the stone road of the city.
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)

Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red aura)

. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

A Fallen Guardpost
Remnants of the guard tower still sit atop the walls of the city here,
although not nearly enough to remain usable. Splinters of wood are all that
remains of the supporting beams and the ladder that were once used to gain
access to the tower.

once busy, bustling market road has seen few travelers in recent times.

left, save the restaurant to the east that has somehow, miraculously
survived all this time.

Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the city.

Near the Tarsis Wastelands

it, like the rest of the city, is barren and desolate. A road branches off
to the south, leading towards the cities inn, while the main road leads
eastward, towards the city square.

The Tarsis Wastelands
Once, these Wastelands served as a walking ground for muggers,
prostitutes, thieves and the like, but now it is dead and barren. The
remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the south,
but it had collapsed onto itself a long time ago, destroying whatever might
have been in it.

The Tarsis Wastelands

faded, it still shows a myriad of color. This wagon once belonged to a
gypsy fortune teller, although there are no signs of any life around here
anymore.

The Tarsis Wastelands
The faint smell of decaying trash wafts in from the west on an unfelt
breeze. Although the city has long since been abandonned and deserted,
leaving the dump unused, the prominent smell of garbage will probably
linger here for some time still to come.

familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

586H 39V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW> bas elrik
Zug flies west.
Sharmaine flies west.
You follow Zug west.
Epso flies in from the east.
Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
The Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.

The Tarsis Wastelands
Once, these Wastelands served as a walking ground for muggers,
prostitutes, thieves and the like, but now it is dead and barren. The
remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the south,
but it had collapsed onto itself a long time ago, destroying whatever might
have been in it.

Near the Tarsis Wastelands
The broken road continues westward, towards the Tarsis Wastelands which
was once known for the vagrants and criminals that occupied the area. Now
it, like the rest of the city, is barren and desolate. A road branches off
to the south, leading towards the cities inn, while the main road leads
eastward, towards the city square.

buildings, most of them empty shells or heaps of rubble.

Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the city.

Eastern Road
Weeds separated and broken through the stone tiles that once made up
this road, but even those weeds have long since died away. Each footfall
echoes through the shattered, skeletal remains of the buildings to the
north. All that remains of the southeastern corner of the city is a huge,
ominous crater.

586H 25V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW>
Zug flies east.
Sharmaine flies east.
You follow Zug east.
Epso flies in from the west.
Lashe flies in from the west.
Vittu flies in from the west.
East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.

Wall Road
All that is left of the road to the north is a huge pile of rubble. The
outer city wall has fallen inward, blocking the path to the north. A small
road leads west, into the marketplace, and the cities east gate is just a
short distance south from here.

Zug flies west.
Sharmaine flies west.
You follow Zug west.
Epso flies in from the east.
Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with rubble.
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)

Epso flies in from the south.
Lashe flies in from the south.
Vittu flies in from the south.
Wall Road
Once there was an immense lookout tower at the northeast corner of
Tarsis that provided city guards with a vantage point to survey the
surrounding landscape. That tower collapsed inward, into the city, bringing
a large section of the city wall with it. The entire road leading east is
blocked by the fallen stone and rubble now, the only exits are a road
leading south into the market, and west towards the northern gate.

Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the city.
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)

Western Road
Large cracks in the stone tiles of the road indicate that the
foundation this road was set on has shifted and changed over time. This
road leads east to the cities fountain, and westwards towards the Tarsis
wastelands.

Southern Road
A massive, charred crater is all that remains of the southeastern part
of the city. Whatever struck this city and left it in its ruined state must
have rivaled the destructive force of the Cataclysm to have levelled this
large a section of the city. Despite it's poor condition, the road leading
west is in much better condition than the road that once lead eastward.

A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

Forgotten Stables
The eastern half of this huge building has collapsed onto itself,
leaving half of the stables buried and unusable. Most of the horse stalls
have been destroyed or fallen to ruin. This chamber has not seen a horse
for several ages, but the smells normally associated with horses still
lingers here.

A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates. These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.

Before the Forge
Once, many warriors frequented this section of town. Between the
weapons shop to the south, the inn just a short distance to the west and
the bar to the north, everything a young warrior needed could be found
here. Now, the only thing left of the building to the north is a pile of
rubble and the shop to the south has long since been deserted.

Outside the Tarsis Inn
The Tarsis Inn, to the west, is one of the few buildings that remains
mostly intact. The sign that once hung above the inns door has nearly
fallen from its perch: it hangs by a single hook now, ready to fall and
shatter itself onto the cobblestone road.

The lobby of the inn is barren and empty, save the single large
receptionists desk. The stairs leading up to the inns bedrooms have been
crushed under rubble and are no longer usable, but you doubt there would be
anything worthy of note in the rooms above.

Lashe flies in from the north.
Vittu flies in from the north.
The Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.

Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

The Tarsis Wastelands
The faint smell of decaying trash wafts in from the west on an unfelt
breeze. Although the city has long since been abandonned and deserted,
leaving the dump unused, the prominent smell of garbage will probably
linger here for some time still to come.

The Tarsis Wastelands
A small wagon rests just north of here, and although the paint has
faded, it still shows a myriad of color. This wagon once belonged to a
gypsy fortune teller, although there are no signs of any life around here
anymore.

A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

Lashe flies in from the west.
Vittu flies in from the west.
Forgotten Stables
The eastern half of this huge building has collapsed onto itself,
leaving half of the stables buried and unusable. Most of the horse stalls
have been destroyed or fallen to ruin. This chamber has not seen a horse
for several ages, but the smells normally associated with horses still
lingers here.

665H 40V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW>
Zug flies west.
Sharmaine flies west.
You follow Zug west.
Epso flies in from the east.
Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
The Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)

. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

to the northeast, you can make out a wagon in this desert wasteland.

The Tarsis Wastelands
Once, these Wastelands served as a walking ground for muggers,
prostitutes, thieves and the like, but now it is dead and barren. The
remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the south,
but it had collapsed onto itself a long time ago, destroying whatever might
have been in it.

Near the Tarsis Wastelands
The broken road continues westward, towards the Tarsis Wastelands which
was once known for the vagrants and criminals that occupied the area. Now
it, like the rest of the city, is barren and desolate. A road branches off
to the south, leading towards the cities inn, while the main road leads
eastward, towards the city square.

The Reception
This is the reception of the lodge, where you would sign in for a
room. This is also a very popular place where adventurers sit around and
share tales of their journeys. Some stairs in the back lead up to the
quarters.
A pair of iron leg plates is lying on the ground.
A whip with nine heads lies here.
A single glove made of scratched leather has been forsaken here.
A small steel key lies here.
You see some iron banded sleeves sitting here.
A wooden bulletin board with the heading 'Wanted' is posted on the wall.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Lord Irvine of the Anarcho-Syndicalist Commune, Hate Inc. is resting here.
Luze, Master of Losses is resting here.
. . . has a tough exterior.
Breaker the Quaker Baker, Sunflower Troublemaker is resting here. (flying) (invisible)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Snick van der Snack, The Executor is resting here. (flying) (invisible) (red aura)
Elyana Lipetskaya, The Queen of Blood Sea Hordes is resting here. (red aura)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Kjama the Female Human is standing here. (flying) (invisible)
. . . has a tough exterior.
Hirum the Male Minotaur is standing here. (flying)
Vocia Vicious, Neon Green Hero is resting here.
The manager of Traveler's Lodge stands here ready to sign you in.
A tall and strong bouncer, hired to protect the lodge's customers, stands here.

665H 87V 13822X 1712C Exits:N> stYou are already standing.

665H 87V 13822X 1712C Exits:N> nTraveler's Lodge
The lodge is famous for its hospitality and friendly service. The
lodge also has its own cafe, where they make great tasting coffee. There is
also a lounge for the guests to rest and relax or do some reading. The
entrance is quite large and open; you get a feeling you will enjoy your
stay here already.
A Knight of Solamnia walks about the inn, keeping it safe.

665H 86V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> eVingaard Avenue South
This is Vingaard Avenue, a well traveled street that runs north-south
through Kalaman. To the north, you see the busy town square and bazaar.
Looking south, you see the poorer part of town, less frequented by the
general populace. The Traveler's Lodge is to the west and a fine diner is
to the east.
A large pigeon is here pecking at some bread crumbs.

665H 85V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> nVingaard Avenue South
This is Vingaard Avenue, a well traveled street that runs north-south
through Kalaman. Just to the north, you see the busy city square and
Kalaman's own open air bazaar is to the east and west. Looking southward,
you see the Traveler's Lodge, where most visitors to Kalaman stay.

665H 84V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> nMarket Square of Kalaman
This square is the busiest part of the city. People of all kinds walk
the city square of Kalaman. Shoppers, merchants and wagons go through this
square non-stop all day long. The air is filled with the smell of food,
spice and anything else you can think of. It is almost impossible to
stretch your arms here without hitting something or someone.
